title: RuPaul's Drag Race celebrity version confirmed for 2020
text:
Drag Race is getting even more spectacular (Picture: RuPaul)

Celebrities, start your engines…

After branching out into the UK, RuPaul’s Drag Race is taking the franchise even further – and has confirmed a celebrity edition.

Perhaps Mama Ru has been watching Simon Cowell’s moves…

VH1 has announced that RuPaul’s Celebrity Drag Race will premiere in 2020, with famous faces undergoing drag makeovers from some of the show’s most beloved queens.

Drag Race series eight winner Bob The Drag Queen, All Stars 3 winner Trixie Mattel, All Stars 4 winners Monet X Change and Trinity The Tuck, and alumni Alyssa Edwards, Nina West, Vanessa Vanjie Mateo, Asia O’Hara, Kim Chi and Monique Heart will all participate in the makeovers.

Miss Vanjie is among the stars returning to give makeovers (Picture: VH1)

Each episode will feature three celebs who receive a drag makeover from the queens, with the stars competing for a title and prize money to donate to a charity of their choice.

Advertisement

Advertisement

We stan a good deed.

RuPaul said: ‘Doing drag does not change who you are, it reveals who you are.

‘I can’t wait for the world to see what happens when our celebrity contestants get all up in drag!’

The celebrity cast has not yet been announced, although makeover challenges are nothing new on the show – with Frankie Grande and YouTuber Tyler Oakley getting all dragged up on season 10 in the queens’ Drag Family Values challenge.

Ru is just getting busier and busier, as RuPaul’s Drag Race will also be returning for its 12th season, and All Stars for its fifth.

Meanwhile, the UK edition premiered three weeks ago on BBC iPlayer and has been a huge hit with fans – with Snatch Game coming his week.

We cannot wait, huntys.

description: RuPaul's Celebrity Drag Race has been confirmed, with famous faces undergoing drag makeovers.
